title: Katie Price fans furious as she lets five-year-old daughter Bunny wear stilettos
text:

Katie Price has landed in hot water as she brought her five-year-old daughter Bunny to an event in heels.

The tot wore pink boots that went over her knees with a pointed toe and uncomfortable looking stiletto heel.

She looked shy as she leant into her mum alongside her siblings Harvey, 16, Princess, 12, and Jett, six.

They were supporting Harvey as he performed in Autism's Got Talent, making his debut stage performance playing the keyboard.

(Image: Instagram)

The photo of Bunny in heels prompted harsh criticism from Katie's followers when she posted it on her Instagram .

She captioned it: "Can’t wait to spend half term with all my kiddies.

"What has everyone got planned for half term?"

One follower implored: "Why is that child wearing stilettos"

"Is bunny wearing high boots for any reason?", asked another.

(Image: Instagram)

"Why is the little girl wearing high heels", said a third.

Katie then posted several photos of Bunny modelling Katie's kids clothes collection.

Bunny and Jett both live with their dad, Kieran Hayler, while Katie shares Junior and Princess with their dad Peter Andre.

(Image: Rex Features)

Harvey now lives in part time residential care so his disabilities can be better cared for.

Katie's parenting skills were also criticised last weekend when she used her kids to plug a drink.

The former glamour model shared a video of Princess and Junior talking about how much they loved their Hey Like Wow drinks.

Alongside the post, Katie also pointed out where you can buy the drinks from and how much they cost.

(Image: Instagram)

Naturally, the video didn’t sit well with everyone, with some of her followers speculating that it could be a sponsored post and accusing her of using her kids 'for profit'.

After initially staying silent on the subject, a day later Katie finally decided to address the backlash.

In a video posted on Monday night, she asks her son: "Junior, you know them Hay Well drinks. Do you like them [sic]?

“Yeah, why?” he replies.

(Image: WEST)

"Because people are saying why I am promoting you to promote a drink. It’s only because I’m getting stick… again."

"Well, why am I not allowed to say what I like?"

"Well, you can," Katie explains. "But just because they think it’s a promotion when I’m actually trying to say they’re good for you and I buy them in Tesco. Like with Harvey he’s not allowed to have anything with sugar in."

She wrote next to the short video: "Saying the kids are promoting. Call me for letting the kids have drinks that are totally sugar free full of vitamins and amazing for Harv too that they love?? Better than them drinking fizzy drinks or juice! Have a day off (sic)."
description: The model and businesswoman has been slammed by her followers for dressing Bunny in knee-high boots with a heel
